# ðŸ›  RTS Project Devlog â€” Building My Real-Time Strategy Game

**Date:** July 22, 2025  
**Author:** Big Boss  

---

## Overview

Welcome to the devlog of my test **Real-Time Strategy (RTS)** project!  
This game is more than just a genre exerciseâ€”it's a technical playground where I'm building complex systems from the ground up: deterministic simulation, AI, unit control, and even a custom scripting backend.

In this post, Iâ€™ll walk through what I've built so far, key systems under the hood, and what's coming next.

---
## Target Gameplay
RTS Engine is a bit of dead genre to speak. Also there isn't that much of things talked about how it works. As in how to make many behavior of the game. visual tricks, pathfinding, etc. It has so many interesting but underutilitzed. I plan to address many of this. Also really want to capture how many classics are still popular to this day in a niche base.
In general few popular concepts needs to be reminded about

- **Deterministic**: for replays and multiplayer. Also each tick must be the same.
- **Modular**: game logic such as (Unit AI, Combat, Behaviors) and visual rendering has to be separated.
- **Customizable**: As in modular database, diverse mechanics which varies across units.

More to be updated soon but for now. I'll keep it limited.
---

## Here''s what I'm actively working on:

* Unit AI system
* Looking for better pathfinding and collision system.
* Ship boarding and naval engagement
* In-editor campaign scripting tool
* Possible Javascript integration with QuickJS? Or use C# Roslyn to run code without compiling as part of Unity
* Unit Testing to replicate bugs and thankfully deterministic simulation helps to catch that out.
* Possibly trying engine beyond Unity for more easier access.

Thanks for reading!  
If you're interested in deep dives on anything related to RTS project then feel free to reach out.

---
